lexUnit.name: impale.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: transfix or pierce with a sharp instrument.

sentence.text: She impaled it through the ribs a second time and the point took and held , and this time when she jerked the Scarag to the side it came with her , clutching at the killing wood .
Police found Mr Pennant , 32 , impaled below the fire escape outside Tottenham 's Arena club in North London .
Harper rode up to the man and saw the broken wheel spokes impaled in his belly and groin .
His lordship suffered too , in his turn , because I heard the occasional stifled oath as he impaled a finger on the needle .
Their heads were impaled on Charles Bridge as a warning to others and their families were sent into exile and their lands given to Ferdinand 's Habsburg supporters , mainly Germans .
He was almost impaled on a bayonet as he slithered into the hole .
His legs were impaled with a thousand needles of pine and hemlock ; hemlock cones and crabapple were strapped to his waist .
They would be impaled by the roadside as an example .
Gunner Paul Johnson was impaled by a fence post -- and lived to tell the tale .
He put the skull of a bird on top of it all , then impaled the heart of his father on the beak of the bird .
Revelation went sweetly on , thus impaling me on the hook of my own guilt once more .
`` Breaking teenagers ' legs and impaling people on railings is no way to end violence , '' Major told the business gathering in reference to recent attacks linked to the IRA .
Otherwise , they could impale themselves with a bayonet --- affixed to each muzzle since the Mexican War .
The two-week-old corpse of an 81-year-old man was exhumed and impaled on an umbrella , 34 tombstones were toppled or snapped in two , and flower pots were trampled .
